title: Meat Loaf
ingredients: 1 pressed garlic clove or 1 tbsp. garlic powder
250 ml beef or vegetable stock (real or made from a soup cube)

content.text: Soak bread cubes in milk until soft/mushy
Fry onions in a little oil or butter until transparent
Put onions aside and let them cool
In a large bowl, mix minced meat with the raw egg, mustard, salt, pepper and garlic
When combined, add bread cubes, fried onions and parsley
Mix it all together and form a loaf like a bread
Add some oil to large oven-proof baking pan, place loaf in the pan and roast for about 10-15 mins. with top heat/grill only. This will give the loaf the base of a crunchy top crust
In the meantime, prepare beef/vegetable stock if using a soup cube

After the top roasting is finished, change to top and bottom heat or hot air and let the loaf roast for a total of another 60-80 mins. During that time, douse with beef/vegetable stock about 3-4 times. This will create a tasty sauce
Serve with mashed, fried or cooked potatoes, maybe also some fried/cooked carrots
Make sure the soup is not too cold, as that may cause a catastrophy.

This is a healthy version of the classic butter cookies also known as shortbread . It is keto-friendly, sugar free and gluten free. It is an easy and quick recipe to make and result has a very similar taste and texture to the original cookies.
(almond flour, salt, Xylitol, chunks of butter and vanilla). Mix them by hand or stand mixer until well-blended.

Knead the dough shortly then pinch off chunks and roll them into 10 balls of same size and place each ball onto a parchment or silicone matt lined oven tray. Leave 1 thumb space between each cookie ball.
Press the balls slightly with the back of a spoon or a cookie stamp so they would be ½ cm thick.
. Make sure to have an eye on them, they could quickly turn brown.
Make the cookie batter and let it
and bake it the next day to get a great texture.
Use a rather fine almond flour and do not replace it with coconut flour!
You could use salted butter and cut the salt from the ingredients.
Recipe By Sahar | Photo by Jennifer Pallian on Unsplash

title: Steak & Beer Pot Pie
ingredients: 1kg rib eye steak or beef filet

content.text: Found this one in a Billa magazine, cooked it about 5 times so far.
Dice the meat, onions and garlic
Heat oil in an iron pot, add meat, salt and pepper; fry for about 5 minutes
Add onions and garlic to the meat, fry briefly
Add thyme and tomato paste, fry briefly and then add beer and soup
Bring everything to a boil, then add the sugar and set a timer for 60 minutes
In the meantime, wash, peel and dice carrots and potatoes, prepare parsley
Add carrots and potatoes to the stew, let boil for another 3o minutes; preheat the oven to 200°C
Mix flour with water until it becomes a thick paste; add this to the stew, followed by the parsley prepared before
Put a lid on the pot and keep it in the oven for about 20 minutes
Let it cool down a bit, prepare and serve
Add puff pastry on top of the pot before putting it into the oven. This will provide a nice "bread" to serve with the stew.
Dark beer makes for a better color, but the recipe also works with normal beer
The dough is optional, but quite a looker when fried on top of the closed iron pot
Recipe By Tom | Photo by Ting Tian on Unsplash

title: American Pizza
description: Thick pizza from the iron pan
ingredients: 1/3 cup canned pureed tomatoes (or tomato sauce)

content.text: 10-inch Cast Iron Pan Pizza Serves two — if you want to feed more people, you need more pans

Mix the yeast, sugar and warm water together in a bowl and let sit for 5 minutes. If the yeast float to the top and start to go foamy, that means they're alive and you're good to proceed. Put in one cup of flour and the 1/2 teaspoon of salt, mix until it comes together, flour your hands and start kneading. Keep adding flour as needed to keep the dough from being untenably sticky, but don't add too much; it should be pretty wet and sticky at the end. Knead until you can stretch it out thin without it tearing. Form the dough into a smooth ball, coat it and the inside of the bowl with olive oil, cover, and let rise — either for at least 24 hours in the fridge, or 1-2 hours at room temperature — until doubled in size.

In a 10-inch cast iron pan (or 10-inch Teflon pan), pour in enough olive oil to coat the bottom well. Put in a pinch of cornmeal, a little oregano, lots of black pepper and a small pinch of salt. Mix that together with your fingers and spread the seasoned oil around the bottom, corners and edges of the pan. Before you wash your hands, grab the risen dough ball and stretch it out a little wider than the pan. Put it in the pan, and let it proof in there for a half hour, until puffy.
For the sauce, combine the tomatoes with a glug of olive oil, a pinch of sugar, and a few torn leaves of fresh basil. Make sure your cheese is ready and kept cold in the fridge.

Put the pan on your largest burner. Turn the burner on medium and your oven's broiler (grill) on high. Spoon the sauce onto the dough and spread it edge to edge. After the heat has been on for about 5 minutes, sprinkle the pizza with parmesan and then the mozzarella, edge to edge. Put on any Toppings (or not), and get ready to transfer the pizza to the oven.

It's hard to tell when the right moment is — in my cast iron pan, 7-8 minutes from the time I turn on the burner is the perfect time, but it takes practice. The best indicator may be your nose — the second you smell something starting to burn, move the pizza. Broil it on a high rack until the top is brown to your liking, 4-5 minutes.

Remove the pizza and let it cool in the pan until firm. Use a butter knife to release the rim of browned cheese from the pan, and then pull the pizza out with tongs. The bottom may stick a bit — you can either try to scrape under there to release it, or simple tear it off with the tongs, it should be solid enough after cooling down to come out intact.

title: Zucchini Fritters
ingredients: Olive Oil or Ghee for frying

content.text: This is a keto-friendly, easy to make veggie patties.
Put the shredded zucchini in a colander, sprinkle with salt and let it rest for 20 minutes. The salt helps to draw excess water out of the zucchini.
Transfer the shredded zucchini in a kitchen towel and squeeze out as much liquid as you can.
Put the eggs into a large bowl and beat them with a fork.
Chop the Spring Onions (Green & White Parts) and fold them in.
Add the the rest of the ingredients and combine.
Scoop 3-tablespoon mounds of the mixture into the pan and fry them with medium (NOT high) heat for 2 to 3 minutes, then flip them.
Serve them with a dollop of sour cream and sprinkle of parsley.
Zucchini have a ton of water, and if you don’t remove enough, the middle of the fritters will seem soggy.
4 Cups Shredded Zucchini should turn to 2 cups after loosing water!
Use a cheese grater or the small part of the normal grater for the parmesan!
I replaced the almond flour with rice flour and it was fine!
Recipe By Sahar | Photo by timolina on Freepik.com

title: Paprika Chicken
description: Red, saucy paprika chicken with rice

content.text: Paprika chicken with rice, inspired by Hungarian food.
Cut the chicken, then mix it with salt, pepper and paprika powder and leave it in a bowl while cutting the paprika and onions.
Measure the rice, add 2x rice amount of water to it and heat it in a pot (with the lid on) until it's boiling. Turn down to minimum heat after that and leave the rice in the pot until done.

Heat oil in a deep (iron) pan, add onions and fry until slightly brown. Add marinated chicken, fry for some minutes until no raw meat is visible anymore. Add the cut paprika pieces, turn up the heat and fry for 5-10 minutes
Stir in the whipped cream and bring it to a boil. Add tomato paste and parsely and let it simmer for another 5 minutes.
Make sure the rice is done, serve and enjoy.
It also works with 1/2 of the whipped cream if adding (leftover) vegetable broth before
Adding chili can make this nice and spicy
Recipe By Tom |  Photo by Jenn Kosar on Unsplash
Simple and delicious cheeseburgers with caramelized onions.
Mix minced beef, egg, salt, pepper and garlic powder in a bowl. Add a handful of parmesan and breadcrumbs, mix some more and let it rest for about 15 minutes.
Cut the onion into larger pieces (I thinly slice quaters of the onion) while the meat rests.

Add sliced onion and sugar into one of the pans, stir a little and let fry at medium heat. Keep an eye on them and stir them again occasionally. The heat should be low enough for them not to burn or brown too quickly.
Form 4 meat patties, put them into the other pan (2x2 or all of them at the same time, dependng on the size of your pan). Flip them after about 5 minutes and let them fry some more.

When the onions are almost done (~3 minutes after flipping the meat patties), turn them down to the lowest possible heat (to keep them warm) and add a slice of cheese onto each of the meat patties in the other pan. Turn both pan's heat off and wait until the cheese is soft (but not completely melted)

Prepare the bread rolls while waiting for the cheese, so that you can transfer the burgers onto them right out of the pan. Once on the bread roll, add the caramelized onions on top of the cheese, garnish with saladleaves and anything else you feel like and serve.
don't be lazy - make the buns, don't buy them ;)

title: Teriyaki Chicken
description: Served with fried rice, carrot and broccoli

content.text: The easiest and tastiest way of making teriyaki chicken we've come across so far.
Mix chicken, 1/4 cup of teriyaki sauce, salt and pepper in a closable container and leave it in the fridge for at least an hour.
Wash, peel and slice the carrots in the meantime; slice the onion and peel the garlic clove. If using frozen broccoli, it can be taken out of the freezer already.

Once the chicken has had at least 1 hour in the fridge, start cooking the rice - it needs 2x the amount of water, that's 2 cups. Add a bit of salt to it, put the lid on the pot the rice and water is in and start heating it on the stove. Once it boils, turn down the heat as low as possible and make sure that the lid is not completely closing the pot - a bit of steam should be able to get out. The rice is finished when all the water's gone.
Heat oil in a wok and fry the chicken for about 5 minutes at high heat. Take it out of the pan, put it into a bowl and cover it with a plate (to keep it warm).

Put the wok back on the stove, ad some more oil and fry the sliced onions and the freshly squeezed garlic. Add the liced carrots after about 3-5 minutes - the onions shouldn't get brown. Fry for another 5 minutes, then add the broccoli and fry until the broccoli is soft.
Take the vegetables out of the pan, add it to the bowl of fried chicken and make sure it all stays covered (=warm).

Heat some more oil in the wok, add the cooked rice and fry it for about 3 minutes (until it becomes puffy). Turn down the heat, add the chicken and vegetables from the bowl and mix it with the rice. Add the remaining 1/4 cup of teriyaki sauce and mix well. Add the chopped coriander, mix again and serve.
if you want it spicy, add Sriracha sauce when serving
Recipe By Tom | Photo by timolina on Freepik
A fun to make and alway delicious dessert.

Mix flour, eggs and milk in a bowl until well combined. Best use a whisk to do that and make sure there aren't any chunks of flour. Add a pinch of salt and a drop of sparkling water, then let the batter rest for 15 minutes.

Heat a bit of butter (or neutral vegetable oil) in a large (~28 cm) pan, add a ladle full of batter in the center and move the pan around so it covers the whole pan evenly. Fry for 1-2 minutes (until it's able to slide around in the pan), then turn it around and fry for another 1-2- minutes until lightly browned on both sides (up to you, some like it darker, others lighter).
Put the finished palatschinke on a plate, spread jam onto it and roll it. Garnish with powdered sugar and enjoy.
this food doesn't have to be a dessert - using ham and cheese also works.
Recipe By Tom | Photo by Monika Grabkowska on Unsplash
A vegetarian dish based on a creamy zucchini sauce.
Wash the zucchinis, quarter them lengthwise and slice them thinly. The slices shouldn't be thicker than 2-3 mm.
Peel onion and garlic, quarter the onion and slice it thinly.

Prepare a pot of water for the pasta and bring it to a boil. In the meantime, heat a bit of olive oil in a large deep pan, then add the sliced onions and press in the garlic. Fry until slightly yellow, then add the sliced zucchinis.

Stir it all well before adding salt and pepper (2-3 tsp. each), then turn the heat down to low. Let the zucchinis fry for about 5-10 minutes and stir them occasionally. When you notice them turning from (more or less) white to somehow glassy, it's time to start boiling the pasta (the water should be boiling now).
Add the creme fraiche, 2 tsp. of thyme and a pinch of nutmeg to your zucchinis, stir in well and finally add 1/2 cup of parmesan. Mix well and let rest as low heat until the pasta is done.
Strain the pasta, then put it back into the pot you boiled it in. Add the zucchini sauce and mix well with the pasta before serving. Use the remaining parmesan to garnish.
can also be done with half the amount of creme fraiche - add a bit of whipped cream to the sauce instead
break the pasta in half when using longer pasta (like spaghetti)
Recipe By Tom | Photo by Brooke Lark on Unsplash
This is a healthy version of the classic Danish butter cookies. It is keto-friendly, sugar free and gluten free and it is easy and quick to make.
Do not start with preheating the oven!
In a bowl, beat the butter and the xylitol
Add the egg, salt and vanilla extract and beat some more
Fold in the almond flour and stir using a spatula.
transfer the batter into the piping bag and use a star shaped nozzle to pipe them in circles on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. They should be flat.
Put the tray in freezer for 10 minutes before backing them.
. Make sure to have an eye on them, the could quickly turn brown.
put them in freezer for 10 minutes before backing them.

title: Keto Naan Bread
description: Keto version of the Indian flat bread

content.text: This is a healthy version of the classic Indian flat bread also known as Naan. It is keto-friendly, sugar free and gluten free. It is an easy and quick recipe to make and result has a very similar taste and texture to the original Naan.
In a bowl, add almond flour, salt, baking powder, yogurt and eggs and mix them by spoon.
the shredded mozzarella (in microwave or in a pot) until it is melted.
Add the melted mozzarella to the mixture and mix them by hand or spoon until well-blended.
Knead the dough shortly then divide it into 6 pieces.
Place 3 of them onto a parchment or silicone matt lined oven tray and press them into a flat oval shape.
. Make sure to have an eye on them, they could quickly turn brown!
Ready made shredded mozzarella gives a better result than a fresh mozzarella balls!

This is a homemade and healthy version of the classic American ranch dressing. The base is kefir and sour cream instead of mayonnaise. ranch can be used as a salad dressing, or as dip. It is an easy match with all sorts of veggies and snacks.
Finely chop the parsley and chives.
Mince the garlic using a garlic press.
Beat the sour cream and kefir until it is smooth
Combine all the ingredients and mix them together
You can replace the fresh garlic clove with 1/2 tsp garlic powder
You can replace the fresh parsley with 1 tsp dried parsley
You can replace the fresh chives with 1/4 tsp onion powder
You can add a bit of mustard to boost up the taste.

Apple pie is a signature comfort food and unavoidable. This is a lazy-friendly and semi-healthy version of the classic apple pie.
In a bowl combine egg and milk and beat with a spoon.
Add the rest of the ingredient and knead the dough until well-blended.
make a boll out of the dough and let it rest in the fridge for 20 min
Peal the apples, then cut each into 4 pieces.
Remove the seeds and hard parts from each piece then slice the pieces into thin slices.
Put apples and honey in a pot and cook them on low heat for 10 min the let it cool down.
Spread the dough into a pie mold and cover the edges, then top with the apple mixture.
Sprinkle cinnamon on it and serve with tea or vanilla ice cream.
the the dough rest in fridge for 20 minutes!
Recipe By Sahar | Photo by Dilyara Garifullina on Unsplash
A suitable curry for autumn, makes use of seasonal pumpkin and provides warmth.
Peel and dice potatoes, pumpkin and onion.
Heat butter in a large frying pan (that has a lid), add onion and fry for some minutes.
Add all spices except for salt, mix well and fry for another minute or two.

Add diced potato and pumpkin pieces, then salt and turn up the heat to medium. Fry for a bit, then cover the pan with the lid; set a timer for 10 minutes and stir occasionally. It's ok if the vegetables brown a little, but they shouldn't burn.

Add a splash of water, just enough to cover the bottom of the pan, stir some more then cover it again and set another 10 minute timer. In the meantime, wash the rice and bring it to a boil in a pot (with the lid on) using twice the amount of water (i.e. 2 cups if using 1 cup of rice). Once boiling, turn down the heat to minimum and let the rice slowly cook until done.

Once the second 10 minute timer has finished, add the cream and chopped parsley to the curry, stir well and let it boil (low heat) for about 5 minutes without the lid. Depending on your timing, the rice is done by then; if not, just cover the curry with the lid and let it rest (heat off) until the rice is done.
Serve and enjoy - add some chili sauce if necessary, it's a mild curry.
Works well because the potatoes absorb a lot of the pumpkin flavour.
Recipe By Tom | Photo by Monika Grabkowska on Unsplash

This Einkorn bread recipe is easy to make and it has a rich and rustic taste.
Einkorn is the most primitive form of wheat on Earth. The term Einkorn is a German word that means “single grain”.

Einkorn is packed with nutrition, It is easier to digest and contains more protein and anti-oxidants than modern wheat. Since Einkorn does not have the D chromosome, People with minor gluten sensitives seems to be able to consume it.
warm the milk to the room temperature and whisk in the honey. Then sprinkle the active dry yeast over it. Let the mixture rest for about 5 minutes until the yeast begins to foam and sink.
In a large bowl, add flour, salt,
butter and the yeast mixture and gently knead the dough a couple of times. Do not over work it! kneading is just to combine.
Place the loaf in a parchment lined
and let it rest for 1 to 2 hours. (you can even let it rest overnight!)
. Make sure to have an eye on it!

on a wire rack before enjoying it!

You can replace the milk with water and the butter with olive oil.

The term "chai" is he Hindi word for Tea and "Masala" is the Hindi word for Spice.
in general, Therefore saying "chai tea", is like saying "tea tea"
This is a common mistake. Numerous coffee houses are referring to
spiced tea with a lot of milk!
Essentially Masala Chai is black tea infused in milk with fragrant spices and sweetener.
The spices that go into chai can vary from region to region or even household to household just like garam masala.
I make this drink very often, specially during the winter time. For the sake of convenience, I measure and ground the spices and mix it with the black tea for the whole winter season.
35 gram of mixed spices mixed with 70 gram of black tea is my sweet spot! (enough for around 20 cups of masala chai).
Measure the spices and ground the spices together. I use a electric spice grinder but a spice mill or a mortar can do the job as well.
Mix the ground spices with the black tea and keep it in a well sealed jar.
Peel the ginger and crush it with garlic press or the back of a spoon.
Once the milk started to boil,
, then add the ginger, honey and the masala tea mixture and
over a warmer candle or steaming kettle.
before adding the tea and spices. The aim is to brewing them not to boiling them!
Honey is optional and cutting it out of recipe will not change the flavor.

Homemade Classic French Baguette with a golden, crunchy crust on the outside, and a soft, fluffy inside.
Activate the yeast > Warm  up half of the water and pure into a large bowl. Sprinkle yeast on top. Place the bowl in a warm place for about
or until you see foam or small bubbles on top of the mixture.
in flour and salt and mix until just combined into a sticky dough. Cover with a towel and let rest for 45 minutes.

Instead of dusting your hands with flour, wet your hands with a little water and "fold" the dough: Leaving the dough in the bowl, stretch one side of the dough up and then over the top of the dough. Turn the dough 90 degrees and repeat until you've done each side. Flip the dough over, cover, and let rest another 45 minutes.
Repeat this folding and resting process 3 more times.
After the fourth resting  is done, take the dough and place on a

bit of flour so, your hands don't stick and shape each piece into a rectangle (40 centimetres long log about 5 centimetres in diameter.) Then fold each rectangle in half lengthwise and pinch it together.

Gently move the baguettes onto a bakers couche or baguette pan and while transferring, flip them upside down so the folded pinched part is on the button. Then gently stretch out the ends of the rectangles forming the baguette shape.
Cover with an oiled piece of plastic wrap and let rest for
Place a pan on the bottom rack of the oven and fill with boiling water and preheat the oven to 220˚C.
Spray each baguette with a little water. Dust the tops lightly with flour. Make 4-5 deep 45˚ cuts on each roll.
spray the oven with water for extra steam and put the trey in the middle rack of the oven and bake for
or until they are golden brown and sound hollow when tapping on them.
There are three secrets to bake a perfect baguette.
and then let rest for 45 minutes. Then repeat...3 more times.
Secret two > Let your dough rest otherwise you will not have the soft, fluffy, hollow center.
Secret three > Preheat the oven with a bowl of
water and  once ready to bake, spray the oven with water for extra steam. The steam will  give you the crunchy crust.

Artisan is not a label. It’s a whole approach to a product. In truth, the story of artisan is actually one about culture (how it’s made) and nature (what it’s made of).
, and is defined as an skilled crafts person or a crafting method to make distinctive product in small quantities, usually by hand and using traditional methods: as in food
Artisan bread is a short shelf-life
, it is better to be consumed immediately after baking for maximum freshness.
Do not let the long resting time freak you out! This actually is a very beginner friendly recipe and impossible to mess it up. The trick is to use a high quality flour.

Recipe By Sahar | Photo by Dora Cavallo on Unsplash
of sourdough fermentation likely relates to the origin of agriculture in the Fertile Crescent (a region in the Middle East)several thousand years ago.

Flour naturally contains a variety of yeasts and bacteria. When wheat flour comes into contact with water, the naturally occurring enzyme amylase breaks down the starch into the sugars glucose and maltose, which sourdough's natural yeast can metabolize. With sufficient time, temperature, and refreshments with new or fresh dough, the mixture develops a stable culture. This culture will cause a dough to rise.
The preparation of sourdough begins with a fermented mixture of flour and water, containing a colony of microorganisms including wild yeast and lactobacilli, this is called the starter.
and to develop the flavour of the bread. In practice there are several kinds of starters, as the ratio of water to flour in the starter (
) varies. A starter may be a liquid batter or a stiff dough.
As long as this starter culture is fed flour and water regularly it will remain active. This is your source batch and is called "mother dough".

is a supercharged starter that make your bread rise faster. You can make Leaven, by taking a piece of the starter, feed it with water and flour and leave it to rise for some hours or overnight, at room temperature.
In a small bowl mix the water and flour to form a tacky dough.

of the starter out and put into a clean bowl.

That means you are ready to bake a bread! otherwise you have to wait until the whole 24 hour waiting is passed.

then complete the whole 24 hours and feed again.
This make takes up to day 10th but  normally it happens after a few days.
Until your starter is strong, you will only use 10 g of the starter to feed and discard the rest.
Once your starter is strong and your bread is rising nicely, you can
and refresh it when it is needed.
When you want to bake bread, take the quantity needed and leave the remaining starter in the refrigerator, and when it becomes low, use the recipe from Day 5 to refresh and replenish the starter.
After refreshing, always let the starter to stay at room temperature  for 6 to 10 hours.

to keep it strong. After six months, you can leave it refrigerated for longer. As you keep baking bread, your starter will eventually become mature and will be strong enough to bubble up within 6 to 10 hours.
If you use a water that is too warm, the dough will rot instead of being fermented!
Until your starter is strong, you will only use 10 g of the starter to refresh and discard the rest.
Along the entire process, it would be a good idea to bake breads(any kind) every day. This would speed up the strengthening of the starter by cultivating wild yeasts in your kitchen.
Recycle the excess starter that you were going to discard by adding it to a any kind of einkorn bread dough. You can use any recipe made with active dry yeast.
Recipe By Sahar | Photo by Anshu A on Unsplash
is the most primitive form of wheat on Earth. The term Einkorn is a German word that means “single grain”.

Einkorn is packed with nutrition, It is easier to digest and contains more protein and anti-oxidants than modern wheat. Since Einkorn does not have the D chromosome, People with minor gluten sensitives seems to be able to consume it.
bread is made by the fermentation of dough using
lactobacilli and yeast. The lactic acid produced by that, gives it a more sour taste and improved keeping qualities.
is the most digestible form of whole grain bread. It has a very rustic texture and  the taste has a slight sweetness to it.
is a supercharged starter that make your bread rise faster.  Take a piece of the starter, feed it with water and flour and leave it to rise for some hours or overnight, at room temperature.

In a large bowl, add the water and the leaven and mix with a wooden spoon or Einkorn Kneading Tool to devolve the leaven.

.Once the dough is ready, you can bake it right away or keep it in the fridge for up to 8 hours and bake later. I always let the dough rise, then refrigerate it for 1 hour because It is easier to shape einkorn dough when it is cold.
to work surface. Transfer the dough and do
Turn the dough around, flour it a bit and shape it into a tight round loaf. Dust the loaf generously with flour. on all sides.
Preheat the oven with your Iron Pot (Dutch oven) in it at  to 240°C.

Heavily dust a linen baker couche and place it in a bow then put your round loaf on it and cover loosely. Let the loaf rise at room temperature for 45 to 90 minutes until it has expanded and it shows a few bubbles, but is still a bit firm.
Remove the pot from the oven and take off the lid. Place a parchment paper and flour it lightly.  Invert the loaf  on the parchment paper and  make some shapes with cutter if you wish to.
Use the corners of the parchment paper to lift them both and transfer them into the pot.
Put the lid of the pot on and bake for 20 minutes. Remove the lid and bake for 20 minutes.
Take the loaf out let it cool down on a wire rack.

This nutty chocolate spread is homemade version of the famous Nutella. Original Nutella is made with hazelnuts but I prefer to make it with walnut. You can go nuts and swap it with the nuts of your choice ;)
It can be used as bread spread, frosting for cupcakes or topping for other dessert. It can also go directly to your mouth via a spoon :D
An easy recipe made with just a few simple ingredients, it's creamy and delicious and since I replaced the sugar with Xylitol, it is also keto friendly.
(optional step) you can roast them on a pan over high heat for 5 min or on a sheet pan, into the oven, 200° C for 10 minutes. I rather to use the raw nuts for the sake of nutrition.
Add all the ingredients into a
and mix until it is smooth, about 2 minutes.

, store at room temperature in a dark place. It will stay fresh for about a week. For longer use, store it in the fridge but bring it to room temperature before using it or it may be difficult to spread.
You need a food processor for this recipe and blender can not handle it.
you can replace the walnuts with hazelnuts or any other nuts.
you can replace the walnut oil / hazelnut oil with avocado oil.
Recipe By Sahar | Photo by Bruna Branco on Unsplash
This recipe is my take on the classic Milk Chocolate Fudge Popsicle that was my absolute favorite treat as a child.
I’ve adopt the ingredient in a way that is
(/ˈzænθən/) is an emulsifier food additive made out of fermentation of corn, soy or wheat. It is used for thickening the mixture and preventing the ingredients from separating. It is

If you’re interested in expanding your culinary skills with creative emulsifiers, here are top 5 substitute options you may want to try > Psyllium Husk |  Chia Seeds | Flaxseeds | Gelatine | Agar Agar

is crystallized sugar alcohol. It is a healthy sugar substitute that promote better dental health, prevents cavities and cause lower blood glucose, lower insulin responses and 40 percent fewer calories.
An optimal dosage has not been set, but taking more than 30–40 grams is linked with negative health effects.
Add milk, cream, Erylitol, and cocoa powder into a saucepan and put it over medium heat, whisk constantly until it boils, then continue the stirring and let it cook for about one minute.
Turn the heat off and stir in the vanilla extract. Sprinkle the xanthan gum over it and whisk briskly until it is well combined.
Let it cool down for 15-20 minutes.

Freeze 1 hour, then push the wooden sticks part-way into it and return to the freezer. This is so the wooden sticks wont slip all the way to the bottom! but if your mold already has a lead that holds the sticks in a right position > skip this step and add the stick right a way.
Depend on your freezer's tempreture settings, it needs about 5-10 hours to be ready.
Hold the mold under hot running water for 30 second to make it easier to un-mold.
you can tip it into melted chocolate to give it a hard chocolate coat.
Xanthan gum is a key ingredient in this recipe that give the fudge texture otherwise the result would be a frozen milk chocolate!

If you do not want to use the Xanthan gum you can cut it from the ingredients but you shall replace the cream with 1 1/2 cups Vanilla Greek Yogurt and you shall replace the cocoa powder with 1 1/2 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips and skip the sugar.

or simply spoon it in your mouth :D

This is a very easy and healthy dessert recipe that you can make. It works with most of the fruits. So, you can just change the fruit and have a different taste. It is adjustable to Vegan diet and it can be left in the fridge for about 4-5 days.
In a pot place the gelatin leaves and
the water and let it rest for 5-10 min.
Put the pot on the low heat and stir for
or until the gelatin is melted and
Add the honey or sugar to the gelatin mix and stir until well mixed.
Add the strawberries, lemon juice and rest of the water into the blender and mix until it is smooth, about 2 minutes.
Add the gelatin to the blender
while it is on! (so it wont set)
Transfer the mixture into serving glasses.
Cover them and let it rest for at least 2 hours in the refrigerator. Best is when you let it be in fridge overnight.
Top with some fresh berries and serve it.
1 tablespoon powdered gelatin = 3 sheets leaf gelatin.
You can replace the strawberry with other fruit
EXCEPT >>> Pineapple, Kiwi, Mango and Papaya
. Because those fruits, prevent gelatin from setting.
To adjust it to vegan diet use pectin instead of gelatin.

title: Dinkel Pancakes
ingredients: 2 eggs 500 ml milk 1 pinch of salt Sparkling water Butter Jam of your choice Powdered sugar

content.text: A family favorite weekend breakfast that is  supper fun to make and always delicious.

Mix flour, eggs and milk in a bowl until well combined. Best use a whisk to do that and make sure there aren't any chunks of flour. Add a pinch of salt and a drop of sparkling water, then let the batter rest for 15 minutes.

Heat a bit of butter (or neutral vegetable oil) in a large (~28 cm) pan, add a ladle full of batter in the center and move the pan around so it covers the whole pan evenly. Fry for 1-2 minutes (until it's able to slide around in the pan), then turn it around and fry for another 1-2- minutes until lightly browned on both sides (up to you, some like it darker, others lighter).
Put the finished palatschinke on a plate, spread jam onto it and roll it. Garnish with powdered sugar and enjoy.
this food doesn't have to be a dessert - using ham and cheese also works.
Recipe By Tom | Photo by Le Buzz on Unsplash
Garden Fresh Tomato Sauce is a quick, easy, all-purpose red sauce that can be used as a base sauce for a bunch of different food!
Add 1/2 teaspoon of dried basil and 1/2 teaspoon of dried oregano to make a pizza sauce.
and mix until it is smooth, about 2 minutes.
In a pot, warm the olive oil on a medium heat.
and salt to the olive oil pot then saute them gently for 3 or 4 minutes.
Add the blended tomatoes to pan and simmer slowly for 45 minutes or until it is thicken up. Stire it every a while.
turn off and add herbs of you choice (optional)
, store in fridge. It will stay fresh for 1-2 weeks.
It is not necessary to peel the tomatoes or to remove the seeds but feel free to do so.
You need a food processor for this recipe and blender can not handle it.
The best tomatoes for pizza sauce are Plum or
because they’re a fleshy and they cook well.
If you wish to can this sauce, a water bath of about 45 minutes is recommended.
Do not skip the tomato paste, that gives the sauce the right color and thickness.
you can add onion powder to boost the flavor.

I make carrot juice quiet often and instead off throwing out the leftover, I make this semi-healthy cupcakes with it.
Juice the carrots and measure 300g of the pulps. (the juice is not needed for this recipe!)
warm the milk into room temperature and whisk in honey and melted butter.
In a separate bowl, beat the eggs until it is foamy and then add the mixture of hone, milk and butter.
Add in the rest of the ingredients and mix.
Divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups. I use an ice cream scooper.
Sprinkle cinnamon on it or top with the cream of your choice. I love pairing this with my homemade Nutella!
Let them cool before enjoying. Keep in the fridge, they will remain fresh  for about a week.

This easy peasy chocolate mousse takes 5 min and  a few simple ingredients.  This is the best recipe for using avocados in a dessert and the result is creamy,  delicious, chocolaty and healthy.

and mix until it is smooth, about 2 minutes.
Transfer into 4 serving glasses and let them rest for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator.
Top with berries or your favorite fruit unless you want to have it fully keto.
For a fancy look, add chocolate chips, nuts, coconut flakes or other garnishes.

Take the roll out of the fridge, open it up and distribute the whipped cream over it.

is a Central Europe traditional cake baked in a distinctive circular Bundt mold.
This marble cake may look tricky but it actually is super easy and quick to make. The look and the flavor both are pure old-fashioned Viennese goodness.
In a bowl combine eggs, vanilla extract, butter, yogurt, cream and erythritol then
, baking powder and salt then fold them into the batter using a spatula.
Take a third of the batter out and mix it(the small part) with the cocoa powder.
Grease the Bundt pan with butter and place half of the white batter inside the pan
Put half of the yellow batter into the pan.
Spoon chocolate batter on top (with distance).
Add the rest of the yellow batter on top of that. (don’t worry about covering the chocolate layer completely).
Grab a knife and gently swirl the batters together.
on a wire rack before enjoying it!
Bundt Pan size: 24 cm = 1.5 litres. (you can also use loaf pan instead)

This easy peasy chocolate cake is perfect for the evening cravings, you know! when you want chocolate muffin and you want it now but you also happen to be on keto diet!
well no conflict here, this is easy, quick and keto(zero carb). It pairs nicely with tea, coffee or a cup of milk.
you may as well want to go nuts and add some nuts in the batter :) I love to add walnuts or pecans.

Use a sifter to mix the flour,cocoa powder, baking powder and salt then fold them into the batter using a spatula.

on a wire rack before enjoying it!
